New Records: Mark Vientos became the youngest player in National League history to have three extra-base hits in a postseason game
Key Match Events: Tylor Megill walked Trea Turner and Bryce Harper, and Nick Castellanos lined a hanging slider down the left field line for a single to win the game
Mark Vientos hit a two-run home run in the ninth inning to tie the game
Pete Alonso added to the Mets' lead with an opposite-field home run in the sixth inning
Brandon Nimmo had a great at-bat that resulted in a go-ahead home run in the top of the seventh inning
Post-Match Reflections: The series is now tied 1-1, with Game 3 at Citi Field on Tuesday
Miscellaneous Highlights: Nick Castellanos had three big hits, including the game-tying home run and the walk-off single in the ninth
Mark Vientos had a spectacular day, hitting two home runs and a double
Others: The Mets return home to Citi Field on Tuesday for the first time since Sept. 22 to play Game 3 of the NLDS
LHP Sean Manaea (12-6, 3.47 ERA) faces off against RHP Aaron Nola (14-8, 3.57 ERA)
